Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: chuckghutch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average. The location to downtown and good price is the attraction. The parking lot in front is crowded. You can walk to Dennyâ€™s but not much in the immediate area. If you are needed access to downtown and on a budget I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Wade C
Reviews.Content: Lots of yelling in parking lot, can heat people talking in other rooms. Traffic on Central was very audible in the room. The staff at the hotel does makes the differance, very friendly and outgoing. Hotel is need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: suMountainLover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on presidents day, staff was nice, rooms were good, clean. Only problem was walls, they were so thin, I could hear people talking outside, others must be hearing me as well. Location is perfect, has lots of restaurants around..

Reviews.Title: “BEST customer service EVER”
Reviews.Author: redshirtfriday
Reviews.Content: Hands down, no place no matter how many stars has given the superior customer service this place did. Gm Christi (Kristi?) was the BEST, can't thank her enough, above and beyond is just what they do!!! Nice location too, had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean property!”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: Like other LQs I have stayed at, this was not very modern top. Seemed like they were up there on the bar as far as bedding an all go but still it lacked something to give that modern look may be wall was white that's why i don't know. The staff was slow but helpful enough. There rooms were very clean.LCD was great to watch the soccer game. Quite happy for the price I paid in a area where other wanted 100+ bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Old but clean...”
Reviews.Author: Bretbuzz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the edge of Downtown Dallas in the uptown area. One of only two hotels in the immediate area. It is an old hotel, but they have done a fairly good job of keeping the rooms up to date and clean. The bed was comfortable too. The outside of the hotel, although they have worked on it, is really showing signs of age. The staff was very friendly. Hotel is right on the freeway and right down the street frome some popular night spots so it is very noisy. I stayed here with a group and the hotel is suitable if you need to stay close to this area, but I would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay in an Area of High-Dollar Hotels”
Reviews.Author: chevybb
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here over the Christmas holiday and have no complaints. We were visiting family in this area and found this to be a good place to spend the night (our days we spent visiting). The front desk was helpful and check-in was fast--they gave us a room on the back, away from the highway as we had requested. All the staff we met were friendly and helpful. We were more than happy to comply with no service for Christmas Day, in fact we had requested it before they left a notice in the room---everyone needs time off for family then. Clean rooms, the bathroom is small but adequate. The wi-fi was good. Breakfast was what we'd consider minimal but there is a Denny's in the parking lot, how are you going to compete with that? The property is the oldest of the La Quinta chain we've stayed in and we would rate it only as average but this is no reflection on the staff or management. Sometimes you want more, we didnâ€™t---this was exactly what we needed, a place to come and get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveler25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the hotel would accept dogs with minimal expense. The location is great but there were several issues. The rooms on the freeway side (front) of the hotel are not as well insulated from the street noise as they might be. The room, while large, was somewhat dated but we expected that in a lower cost facility. The breakfast room was very nice and the food was good but limited.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very reasonably priced and super clean.”
Reviews.Author: ScottyG777
Reviews.Content: Being a big La Quinta Inn fan I had to give this location a try; it didn't disappoint. This was my first trip to Dallas and like the legend of things being bigger in Texas, I found that they're often better, too. I thought that this hotel was in a great spot with good access to the main roads. It was in an area with lots of activity but it was still quiet enough to not be intrusive. The front desk gentleman was super nice and the room, although on the small side, was crisp and clean and had everything I like to have when I travel: small refrigerator, hair dryer, ironing board/iron, etc. It's an older hotel that was most likely converted to a La Quinta Inn at some point, but they seemed to do a good job with it. La Quinta is growing and expanding so quickly that there are a lot of locations that are converted from other, sometimes older, hotel chains. Sometimes they're not as successful as others, but I found this one to be great. Whenever you see rooms with an outside-opening door, you know it's an older hotel. That's rarely if ever done anymore. The breakfast was good with some protein (egg) choices which was a nice change. It was all neat and tidy and well-stocked. I think there was a pool here too, but since I was there in December, when even I (someone from Minnesota) was cold, I'm not sure if it was still open or not. Everything in the room worked perfectly and things went as smoothly as I can ever wish for in a hotel stay. There are a ton of food choices in the area as well as Starbucks and other coffee houses if you prefer a stonger brew like I do. There's also a big Target store nearby which was nice. I was here for two or three nights and got to know the area a bit and it seemed nice and safe. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend it to others based on my experience here. As for Dallas itself, I really had a great time and loved the city and the folks I ran across there. Everyone seemed really, genuinely nice and I think that Texas may be the land of big hearts too. I'd love to return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Customer Serv and deal anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: karenm326
Reviews.Content: Above and beyond x1000000.....and did with smiles and respect! From the front desk to the general manager, BEST cust serv anywhere! Also, clean comfy room, great location....and wonderful prices.....by far the BEST experience at any hotel anywhere in the world, literally!

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: Susie H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and it was at a good value. The management was nice and very quick to try and help with any problem. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: ipaint
Reviews.Content: This is a very average hotel. No five star, but that is not what I paid for. The hotel was near the area of the city where we were visiting friends. It is clean with very comfortable beds. We did have trouble with the Wifi connection, but when we were moved to a different room, it worked great. The complimentary breakfast is fine. It helped us save for meals out the rest of the day! If you are looking for a resort experience this isn't your place. But it is a clean, comfortable place with a very friendly staff. Also, Denny's is right next door and there are some wonderful eating options within two blocks!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bandman15
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of LaQuinta properties over the years and, for the most part, have been satisfied. This particular property is the worst. Other than a friendly staff, I would give it an absolute zero. The room was dirty and I mean dirty. The blanket on the bed had not been cleaned in a long time and, if you did wash it, it would probably fall apart. The room next to me had a coule who put a dog in the closet that barked for nearly an hour before I finally had that tended to. There was a group of "ladies" in a taxi about six doors down earlier in the evening who were obviously looking for "someone". They were shouting some name outside and the music was blaring. I finally called security on that one. NEVER again will I stay at this nasty place. The cost was still $100 per night....had it been $50, I might have deserved thsi type of setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: DaveJacqM
Reviews.Content: We had two nights here at the start of a 14 day roadtrip to Los Angeles. The welcome was very warm and friendly, check in was quick. Our room at the rear of the hotel was quiet and fairly well equiped. The room was spotless, bedding was perfect and the bathroom was clean and of a good size. Plenty of parking was also a bonus. The location was good, 20 mins to downtown Dallas, plenty of restaurants within 10 mins walk. Breakfast was ok, not a great selection but enough to cater for most tastes. We really liked this hotel and felt it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Marushka
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel when she had to be in town for business, and it was just fine- easy to find, well-lit, friendly front desk staff, and nice and clean. Chantal at the front desk was very helpful, and even the maintenance staff whe were just working around the property were considerate.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: LauraMae02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Quinta Inn Dallas Uptown for 3 nights. The rooms are comfortable with a great LCD TV, free wireless, and a good sized bathroom with separate sink and shower areas. We stayed on the side away from the Expressway and it was quiet, so I would recommend asking for a room on the back of the hotel. The breakfast is decent: yogurt, hard boiled eggs, toast, cereal, make your own waffle, coffee, and juice. The hotel is very convenient to Uptown (a short 5 minute drive) and the Knox Henderson neighborhoods. You can walk to some restaurants as well (not just the Denny's next door)! The best part is that the staff is very friendly and remembers you from day to day. They also want to make sure you have the best stay possible and are willing to go the extra mile to make sure you are satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Serves a purpose”
Reviews.Author: oeshpdog2
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel very close to downtown Dallas, then this hotel serves that purpose. However, it is outdated in many ways. The rooms resemble more of a older apartment than they do a hotel/motel room. We stayed 1 night to break up our trip as we made our way down to Galveston and will probably not stay here again if we are passing through the same area. The breakfast was lacking, but the location is close to other food venues so I suggest finding breakfast either at the Denny's next door or just drive 5-10 minutes to some other restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “exceptionally friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AndreaChilanga
Reviews.Content: If you need to be in this area and this price range, options are limited. I wouldn't even waste time looking at the Best Western down the road. I've never been there nor heard anything about it but the staff at the La Quinta are above the rest and I'm sure there is no comparison. Basic clean rooms, convenient location, quiet, and most of all GREAT service. Greeted by name, provided with extra towels, coffee and creamer without any issue or problems, given directions and suggestions of where to go. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...and the Most Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TxLnghrnz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the LQ Cityplace and loved the convenient location to downtown activities, restaurants, bars and businesses. Although only there one day, we were pleased to enjoy speaking with each employee -- the security guard that patrolled the lot at night, the maintenance man sweeping up early in the morning, 2 desk clerks (check-in and during the stay) and the manager, Kristie. Each encounter left us smiling...it's refreshing to be able to say that about ALL employees at ANY business these days! From the reassuring wave from the security guard twice during the night (we were visiting a greyhound adoption event, and had two-in-tow that had to go!) to the maintenance man early the next morning who greeted us with a perky "Good Morning!" made us feel we had made the right choice with this LQ property. We originally arrived a little early and the desk clerk joyfully took our cell phone number, directed us to a nearby park (dogs..remember?) and gave us a call as soon as the room was ready. Making waffles in the morning, I bypassed the instructions, and the on-duty desk clerk came out and helped solve the problem of the beeping waffle iron, as I'm sure she has been doing for years, but she still made conversation and showed me exactly how it all worked! The room was very clean (it's an older LQ property...I think I even stayed at the same location over 20 years ago), and the remodeled room was perfect. We stayed in a 2 room, 3-double bed corner room...which would be great for a family, or several business associates traveling together...as each room had its own TV, dresser, alarm clock, etc. Like with all La Quinta properties, this one had a great work desk, free internet and wonderful waffles & muffins in the morning! Being located right on the Central Expressway, traffic noises were heard 24-hours a day...but we found leaving the A/C or fan running blocked all, but the loudest noises. While mentioning the A/C...you should be warned...it gets COLD fast (no complaints here...we were visiting Dallas in July and loved every chilled minute we stayed in the room!) There are many, many, many restaurants a short walk or drive from the motel -- even some great little pubs right around the corner. Since we were traveling with dogs, we appreciated the nice, clean dog-walking lawn...it was park-like! With the complimentary "waste disposal" bags right there...it was nice and clean...and "land-mine" free! We have stayed with the dogs at other LQ properties, where the grass was not watered, and it was nasty...definitely NOT the case here. Like I mentioned, it was park-like (and well maintained.) There is a nice big swimming pool that we can't wait to try out on the next visit. Being an older property, we expected a not-so-wonderful experience...but, it was so nice, that we are already planning return visits to this La Quinta real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in service of an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: customer68
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel as I had a one night layover before heading back to Atlanta. I asked if the hotel had a shuttle to and from the airport and the concierge said yes prior to me booking. Since I was literally just staying at the hotel for the use of a bed and shower with a quick layover, price and comfort was important.. I arrived into Dallas, TX at around 11:20pm to find out that the hotel stopped shuttle service at 11pm and to pay a $24 cab ride to go 2 miles to the hotel. To make matters worse, when I checked in, I found out that the shuttle to the airport only runs once every hour at the top of the hour. Well since my flight was at 8:55am I had to catch the 7am shuttle along with miss the free continental breakfast which started at 7am - What kind of service is this for an airport hotel when there are tons of hotels to choose from? Unhappy guest...

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises”
Reviews.Author: Douglas M
Reviews.Content: Friendly, efficient check-in. Clean rooms. This is a slightly older La Quinta property, but is well-maintained. The parking lot is tight. Breakfast is typical La Quinta. It will fill you up, but it won't leave you with a great feeling of satisfaction. For those interested in a little variety there are many restaurants nearby, and the Uptown area is just a few blocks away. There you will find just about anything in the way of food and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the Tut Exhibit”
Reviews.Author: Kelly F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. We drove up Thursday morning & once we checked in, headed to the King Tut exhibit. (Note: while there may be a bus stop nearby that will take you to the Mockingbird Station, the easiest thing to do is walk or drive down the access road to Mockingbird to get there; then take the red or blue line to St. Paul Station & walk up Harwood to the Museum). The room was clean, the beds new. I did notice the noise of the freeway, but it didn't bother my sleep (I was very tired). There are some neat-looking local places to eat about a block away on Henderson. The staff was very friendly & helpful. We left too early to try the breakfast, though. :(

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: rottendog
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here as we were in town for the Texas State Fair. It was fairly convenient to the fair, wasn't too hard to manuever going back in the wee-morning hours to take care of our animals. The big issue we had was the parking lot. Small spaces, very tight corners - hard to do when the lot is full of 4 door trucks and suburbans. The hotel is right next door to a Denny's, and several other restaurants as mentioned previously are night across the freeway. Our room was on the freeway side, and we never noticed the noise once we were in our room. The room was clean, we had no issues there. Staff was very friendly, making it a point to look me in the eye and ask "how are you tonight" as we were checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Staff”
Reviews.Author: stopg0
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for work and usually stay at La Quintas and while I may have stayed in newer or nicer locations, I have not come across a more pleasant staff. A great value in the heart of the nice part of town, the building is slightly older but the rooms have been redone recently. Not much noise from the expressway and plenty of places to eat within walking distance. I was more than pleased with my stay there and will be staying there again when I return to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: Aimster77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night while I was working Dallas Market. Very convenient location, and lots of great restaurants within walking distance. The staff is fantastic. Super friendly. The only bad thing was a hair in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: elledorado
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently during a cross-country move. I chose this La Quinta for a combination of reasons -- great location (across the highway from Highland Park and a strip mall with plenty of places to eat), pet friendly, and low cost ($69/night). There were a couple of minor mishaps when we first checked in. First, our key cards didn't work on the room that was assigned to us (it turned out both of the key cards were coincidentally faulty). Then, we were given another room, but the tv didn't work. Finally, the hotel staff were kind enough to move us to the suite, where we had two working tv's and a minifridge. The staff were very gracious throughout each of the various mishaps and were extremely attentive to our needs. The suite (which featured a king size bed in the bedroom and a separated living room with a couch) was definitely nicer than the normal room (two double beds), which is on the small side. It did look like complimentary wireless internet access was available in every room (the non-suite room actually had its own wireless router attached to the desk). As I mentioned, the location is great, and we had dinner at a wonderful Indian restaurant across the street. We really appreciated having dining options other than the usual Cracker Barrel or Chili's fare. Even though the La Quinta is right on the interstate, we did not notice any bothersome levels of noise (and our suite was even on the side of the building facing the interstate). The complimentary continental breakfast was typical but at least had fresh fruit (strawberries, grapes, and bananas), which is all I ask of my continental breakfasts. Overall, we had a pleasant stay, thanks in large part to the staff. They were friendly and helpful and willing to go the extra mile to make us comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: KSLawDawg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this motel for its location, which is great. Lots of great restuarants and shops around the area. This is an older property where the door to the room is adjacent to the parking lot. We were a little disappointed when we entered the non-smoking room. It smelled as if it had been a "smoking" room at some point in the not-so-distance past. The carpet also looked a little worn. Other than that, the room was clean and the bed was pretty comfortable. The free Wi-Fi was nice too. A free continental breakfast was offered and it was pretty standard. They did offer fresh fruit which was a nice touch. The staff was great and very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property at least 30 days each year (2 to 3 nights each month) and have found it to be an excellent property in the price range. The staff is fantastic and the rooms are clean and well prepared. The neighborhood is safe and I love the proximity to places like Chuy's and The Old Monk. Great restaurants and bars are within walking distance (No DUI's!) and a cab will be at your door within five minutes of a call. Distance to downtown and the AA Center is 10 minutes and to Northpark Mall about eight minutes the other direction. Stay in a room facing the rear if traffic noise bothers you (it doesn't me so I always stay in a pool room on the second floor). This property is super close to SMU and the Gerald Ford Stadium. Try a Last Minute Deal on the La Quinta website and this property can be booked at a weekend rate of $59!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at La Quinta!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenPerna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the La Quinta Dallas CityPlace for 1 night in January. The lobby was inviting, spacious, and clean. Check in was quick and easy, no hassles. I got to stay free with my Returns points, which is always an added bonus. The woman on duty gave me a nice room on the main floor facing the front of the hotel per my request. My room was very large and super clean. The bathroom was also very big and very clean. There's tons of free parking. Breakfast was good and served in a large area with plenty of seating. It wasn't busy and I could sit, relax, and watch the TV. There are several restaurants within walking distance, including Dennys next door. It was only a few blocks to McKinney street and a short drive to downtown, including Reunion Tower. All staff were so friendly and helpful, going out of their way to give me directions or help. The woman who checked me in gave me plenty of maps and brochures and even stepped outside to show me different landmarks and specific directions. The woman who checked me out also went out of her way being friendly and helpful with directions. I only had a few complaints. The hotel is a bit difficult to find off of the freeway (I found all of Texas a bit difficult at first because it is all freeways and one way streets). But once you know your exit, it's not too bad. Second, the window opened but had no screen and didn't lock when open. So you really couldn't ever leave your window open because anyone walking by could open the window all the way and climb in the room. Strange!! There's no Internet station which is difficult for me because I don't bring a laptop. I'm not entirely sure how safe this neighborhood is because there were tons of signs suggesting you lock your vehicle, and I saw police all over sitting in their car, driving around, walking around, basically on watch. I'm not sure what this meant. But I always felt safe. Lastly, if your room faces the front of the hotel you are basically ON the highway and it's noisy. I don't mind this, but if you want it quiet just ask for a room facing the back. Please email me if you have any questions, JenPerna@aol.com. Thanks for reading!!

Reviews.Title: “For the price it is great.”
Reviews.Author: inca_me
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, you can't beat it. I took the advice of staying upstairs and a room in back section (away from traffic). Could hardly hear the traffic (though the room heater was a bit loud when it would cycle on-turned it off for the 2nd night). Security guard was patrolling the parking lot. Fast check-in and check-out. Kind staff, good with driving directions. Room was very clean. Breakfast was fine - continental, good variety, remember this isn't a bed and breakfast. (you can always go to Denny's next door) Great location to downtown. I would stay there again if I'm on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Convient to downtown but too close to the highway”
Reviews.Author: billnict
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Rolling Stones concert and just needed a hotel for the night of the concert that was convient to the American Airlines Center. It was definitely convenient to the arena; 10 minute drive during rush hour. But the traffic noise from the North Central Expressway in our room was horrendous! Also, the continetal breakfast was sub-par in our opinion with packaged danish, bagels, and muffins like you would get out of a vending machine. On the positive side; this LaQuinta is an older property but it appears to have been taken pretty good care of. The staff was friendly and courteous and the parking lot was patrolled by a security guard or police officer on foot late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you LaQuinta!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here 3 nights-our son was married at Elm Place. This hotel is the best! Not only was everything squeaky clean, working perfectly,(couldn't ask for a better staff) , but everything you need is so close-10 min. from Downtown. I visit Dallas often, and I will definately book this hotel...Thanks LaQuinta Sincerely, Frank&Allison Robinson

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: duluth1200
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. It was easy to get to, and very close to the downtown area of Dallas. The rooms were older, but renovated nicely. Friendly staff, clean, and decent pool. I used hotwire and paid only $35, so well worth the money. Oh, and great restaraunts nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Dallas Uptown
HotelInfo.Address: 4440 N. Central Expressway, Dallas, TX 75206-6525
